questions.prompt: List the main character defects you identified in Steps Four and Five.
Which defect causes you the most problems in your life?
questions.help: Consider the impact on relationships and well-being.

questions.prompt: Which defect are you most willing to have removed?
questions.help: Willingness is the key to this step.

questions.prompt: Which defect are you least willing to have removed? Why?
questions.help: Be honest about your attachments to certain behaviors.

questions.prompt: What are you afraid will happen if this defect is removed?
questions.help: Our defects often feel like protection or identity.

questions.prompt: How has holding onto this defect served you in the past?
questions.help: Consider what you think you gain from it.

questions.prompt: How has this defect hurt you and others?
questions.help: Look at the real costs of this behavior.

questions.prompt: What would your life look like without this defect?
Are you willing to let your Higher Power remove this defect?
questions.help: This is about willingness, not perfection.

questions.prompt: What obstacles stand between you and complete willingness?
How can you work on becoming more willing?
questions.help: Consider prayer, meditation, or talking with your sponsor.

questions.prompt: What does 'entirely ready' mean to you?
questions.help: Reflect on the completeness this step asks for.

questions.prompt: Do you believe your Higher Power can remove these defects?
Are you willing to do your part in changing these behaviors?
questions.help: Recovery requires both surrender and action.

questions.prompt: Are you entirely ready to have all your defects of character removed?
questions.help: This is the essence of Step Six.
